org.spongepowered.api.entity.living

Interface Human

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ArmorEquipable, Carrier, DataHolder, Entity, EntityState, Equipable, Identifiable, Living, ProjectileSource, Tamer
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Player

    public interface Human
extends Living, ProjectileSource, ArmorEquipable, Tamer, Carrier
    Represents a HumanEntity in game, such as Player

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeInventory()
      Closes the currently viewed entity of this human entity, if it is currently viewing one.
      int getExperience()
      Gets the current experience towards the next level.

      Gets the hunger value of this human entity.

      Gets the current food saturation of this human entity.
      int getTotalExperinece()
      Gets the total accumulated experience this human has, including the experience to achieve the current experience level and the experienced gained towards the next level.
      boolean isViewingInventory()
      Returns whether this human entity has an open inventory at the moment or not.

      Opens the given Inventory for the player to view.

    • Method Detail

      • getHunger

        float getHunger()
        Gets the hunger value of this human entity.

        Hunger is a type of exhaustion such that when the exhaustion depletes, saturation may begin to diminish.

        Returns:
        The current hunger

      • setHunger

        void setHunger(float hunger)
        Sets the hunger value of this human entity.

        Hunger is a type of exhaustion such that when the exhaustion depletes, saturation may begin to diminish.

        Parameters:
        hunger - The hunger level

      • getSaturation

        float getSaturation()
        Gets the current food saturation of this human entity.

        Saturation has health effects, depending on game difficulty and hunger levels. If the saturation is high enough, the human entity may heal. If the saturation is at 0, the human entity may starve.

        Returns:
        The current saturation level

      • setSaturation

        void setSaturation(float saturation)
        Sets the current food saturation of this human entity.

        Saturation has health effects, depending on game difficulty and hunger levels. If the saturation is high enough, the human entity may heal. If the saturation is at 0, the human entity may starve.

        Parameters:
        saturation - The saturation level to set

      • getExperience

        int getExperience()
        Gets the current experience towards the next level.

        This is not the total experience this human has.

        Returns:
        The current experience towards the next level

      • setExperience

        void setExperience(int experience)
        Sets the experience accumulated towards the next level.
        Parameters:
        experience - The experience

      • getLevel

        int getLevel()
        Gets the current experience level of this human.
        Returns:
        The current level

      • setLevel

        void setLevel(int level)
        Sets the level of experience.
        Parameters:
        level - The level of experience

      • getTotalExperinece

        int getTotalExperinece()
        Gets the total accumulated experience this human has, including the experience to achieve the current experience level and the experienced gained towards the next level.
        Returns:
        The current total accumulated experience

      • setTotalExperience

        void setTotalExperience(int totalExperience)
        Sets the total accumulated experience starting from zero.
        Parameters:
        totalExperience - The total experience

      • isViewingInventory

        boolean isViewingInventory()
        Returns whether this human entity has an open inventory at the moment or not.
        Returns:
        Whether this human is viewing an inventory or not

      • getOpenInventory

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Inventory> getOpenInventory()
        Gets the currently viewed inventory of this human entity, if it is currently viewing one.
        Returns:
        An inventory if this human entity is viewing one, otherwise Optional.absent()

      • openInventory

        void openInventory(Inventory inventory)
        Opens the given Inventory for the player to view.
        Parameters:
        inventory - The inventory to view

      • closeInventory

        void closeInventory()
        Closes the currently viewed entity of this human entity, if it is currently viewing one.
